text: Bottle. Dark hazy brownish orange with golden highlights and a foamy khaki head thats gone in a flash. Aroma of caramel, dark figgy fruit, banana, and bubblegummy yeast phenols. Tastes phenolic, moderately sweet and not at all boozy tasting for the abv. Medium, semi-syrupy bodied, very softly carbonated.

Gushing przy otwieraniu, piana średnio obfita, dość trwała, barwa rubinowa, lekko opalizująca. Aromat estrowy, głównie kandyzowane morele, suszone brzoskwinie, rodzynki, karmel, syrop klonowy, w tle przyprawy. W smaku podobnie, słodkie, wyklejające, dominują kandyzowane i suszone owoce oraz delikatnie pikantne fenole, w tle posmaki czerwonego wina, porto i ciasta drożdżowego. Goryczka nieduża ziołowo pestkowa, przyjemnie rozgrzewanie od alkoholu na finiszu. Wysycenie średnie, lepkie, gładkie, oleiste w odbiorze.

Dość klasyczne, ani ciemne ani jasne, BSA, kumulujące w sobie wszystko to, co charakterystyczne dla belgijskich drożdży i piw mocnych, aczkolwiek od AleSmith chciałoby się czegoś nieco ponad standard, zwłaszcza przy tej cenie za regularne piwo.

I can get through the second and third tier beers to appreciate an offering like Grand Cru. Bought with a number of other beers at Total Wine in the Dallas area some time back. Held back for just the right time, today was the day. The 750 ml bottle pours into my Buffalo Bayou snifter an interesting cinnamon brown body with a slight, egg-shell white head. I scent toffee, spices and ripe fruit. With a drink I find red plum, strawberry jam, something yeasty and a mighty fine touch of bitterness throughout. The 10% abv is completely covered up. First Speedway Stout and now Grand Cru, AleSmith is certainly doing it right for me.

Clear mahogany brown pour with no head at all. Plummy dark red fruit. Fairly juicy and very sweet but with a bit of spice on the end. Raisin brandy flambee. Glossy chocolate liquorice. Black currants. Homemade root beer. Vegemite. Anchovies. Worcestershire sauce. Merlot. Celery root. Bamboo shoots. Shittake mushrooms. Oyster sauce. Dark caramel toffees. The alcohol feels more prominent as it warms. Medium syrupy body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aus der Flasche (2015) 2017-05 getrunken. Ein perfekt, gelagertes typisches Quardruple mit ausgewogenen Malznoten. Wunderbar!

750 ml bottle, from Vinmonopolet. ABV is 10%. Brown colour, moderate off-white to beige head. Malty aroma, also notes of brown kandij sugar, molasses, dark dried fruits and alcohol. The fairly sweet flavour has the same elements as the aroma, also hints of oak and chocolate.
Bottle at home, Nivala. Vintage 2013. Colour is dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dry fruits, dark fruits, plums, raisins and malts.

Dark and hazy garnet color with a creamy head of tan foam. Luxuriant plum, fig, caramel, and sweet bread embrace the senses. A sweet and slightly spiced finish make this a very pleasant Belgian inspired strong ale.

Pours a rusty orange color with medium head. Aroma/Taste: burnt caramel, toffee, Belgian yeast, plums, figs and vanilla with a sweet and citrusy aftertaste. Definitely a beer that will improve with age.
750 ml bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $12.99 Very good!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Very welcoming nose, dates and plums stuck to a banana via caramel. Looks okay, not very Belgian, good color but the head sucks and lace is a no-go. Taste starts strong but loses complexity; plenty of minor notes--caramel, bananas, cloves, apricots, dates, hazelnut, white grape, tea (black and chai) with a toasty, booze-laden finish--yet the more it warms, the more flat candi sugar sweetness takes over. Still, the alcohol is mild, the sugars never grow cloy, and my glass seems to keep emptying, so I shouldnt complain too much.

bomber to snifter poured a brown red color but more cloudy red no head. sweet warm malt base, dark fruits like plum or raisins, caramel smooth. the flavor was so soft and delicious. this was a 2015 bottle and hasnt lost a thing. you get that sweet malt and dark fruit and a very soft burn of the alcohol on the end. truly delicious and wonderful.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malts and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/dark brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit and chocolate; ends sloggtlt bitter and dry with roasted malts and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Great Belgian profile with some American aspects sipping through. Amazing palate both in terms of mouthfeel as in terms of flavour profile.

Geproefd @ RBBWG 2017. Kleur is amber, karamel met kleine witte schuimkraag. Veel gas. Geur is zoet, een of andere sterke drank en appeltjes. Smaak is zoet, sterk alcoholisch en een tikkeltje donkere chocolade.
Sampled at the RBBWG 2017. Thnx for sharing, everyone ! Pours dark, clear amber. Small white head. Smell is rich, full, grainy sweetness. Taste is full, mild bitter, bit boozy, some dark fruits.

Aroma: caramel, molasses, raisins, dried fruits
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, caramel, molasses, some dried fruits, raisins and prune

Thank you kraddel! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG VI (2017). +/- 2 years old. Amber orange, little head. Nose is oxidation, sweet malt sugar, orange peel, barn stale, esters coated in this sugary malt base. Taste is thick low herbal candy, sweet sugar, oxidation, boozy, malt, hay, stale bread, sugar. Body is thick boozy malts. Pretty interesting & nice, oxidation is starting to eat away at it.

7/2015 bottle, 12C. Clear mid brown with a off white head that doesnt last. 3 Aroma of light dough, spices, dried fruit. Quite La Trappe Quad-like. Although it has a dark sugary note that weighs it down a little, the taste follows - sweet and yeasty with dried fruit and and mace. Alcohol is fairly prominent and helps it feel like it dries out a bit at the gently bitter finish. Rather less ambitious than expected, but its a cheerful strong beer with a lot going for it.

750 ml bottle shared at Old Town Pizza and Tap House. 2015 vintage. Clear amber with beige head. Aromas of biscuit, toffee, light booze, dark fruit. Tastes of caramel, toffee, biscuit, slight dark fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.

AleSmith Grand Cru seems a bit overrated. Reddish translucent pour with zero head. Some malt aroma. Taste is flat with some sweet caramel balanced by some maltiness and booziness. Not very complex. Either I got a bad bottle or Grand Crus gold wrapper is fooling people.

Type: 32-oz. growler
Glass: Karl Strauss 26th anniversary tulip glass
From: AleSmith in San Diego, Calif. 
Price: $12.00
Purchased: Dec. 31, 2016
Consumed: Dec. 31, 2016
Reviewed as: Belgian Strong Dark Ale
Misc.: N/A

Apparently hadnt had this before purchasing on a trip to AleSmith for Emilys birthday. Grabbed a 32-oz. growler for the festivities later, hoping I would get to review it. Liked it at first sip, giving it a 4.00 on Untappd. Reviewed it roughly six hours later.

Poured a copper amber clear color with two fingers of khaki white frothy head, which thinned out quickly. Decent amount of bubble streams coming up from the bottom of the glass. Decent watery lacing. Decent retention. (Sight - 3.75)

Smelled dark cherry candy, cloves, banana, purple grape, herbal, cherry cough medicine, raspberry and hints of wintry spices. (Smell - 4.00)

Lots of fruits on the tongue. Got cherry candy, followed by a splash of booze, feeling the warmth. Also cloves, plum and purple grape, ending with an abrupt finish. More prodding got me cherry jelly, a touch of banana, dark raisins, wintry spices (nutmeg, touch of cinnamon), Red Vine candy and peppery spices. (Taste - 4.25)

Medium body. Oily texture. Lively carbonation. Long, fruity finish (Feel - 4.25)

This was a good beer for any style. I highly recommend it. (Overall - 4.25)

4.16 93 A-

Bottled 4/22/2015. Aroma is dark fruit, raisins, booze, caramel, toffee, wood, great. Appearance is brown red, light tan head, not clear. Taste is smooth, raisins, booze, dark fruit, wood, caramel, really nice. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, dark fruit and booze aftertaste. Overall, solid.

A 750, foiled only, bottling date smudged off (its at least new to this market). Nose fills the room with fruity esters, very Belgian, with searing phenols and a few burning fusels and dark caramel and plum. Really a gorgeous aroma. Pour a light chestnut that acquires fiery orange and scarlet tones under light, supports a foamy-rocky beige head with lace. Hot in the mouth but not too bad, much stronger are the black pepper and spice that scratch the tongue from front to back. Low bitterness a bit more medium after acclimation, bubblegum on the rise but still only to medium, little flits of pear and cherry, much more orange peel, lots of red berry, ester profile reminds of fresh Rochefort, bright and clear. Fine-grained light-medium carbonation.  Light-medium caramel, lightly sticky lips, fumes are appreciated and help conform to this catch-all style, overall medium body with a bit of fruitcake fullness now and then, and really pleasant burn that even picks up some mint. Id like to try one with some age on it, because this is too hot, but the Rochefort comparisons are an earned compliment. [2016.12.25: 4.3]

Mindig különleges élmény, amikor egy alapvetően belga karakterű ital más nemzetek mestereinek a keze között is autentikus élmény formálója lesz; nem csak a nyomába ér, de az ízhatás terén akár meg is előz néhány eredeti belga produktumot. Illatai parádésak, a rubinos árnyalatokat csillogtató gesztenyeszín test körül tapinthatók a rágógumis, szivárványos élesztős, színes cukorkás aromafelhők, vegytiszta belgian strong ale vonások. A sziporkázó malátás-élesztős tengely mentén ezt követően jegesteás, őszibarackos, süteménytésztás; édeskés, karakteres élesztős jegyek rajzolódnak ki tökéletes rendben, a szerkezet pedig ideális terepnek bizonyul az ízvilág kiteljesedéséhez. Visszafogottabb szénsavtartalom jellemzi ugyanis, mint a hagyományos belga darabokat, ez azonban a legkevésbé sem válik kárára az italnak, számomra így lesz még szimpatikusabb az egyébként is rendkívül megnyerő főzet.

It pours brown with a light tan head. The overall clarity is rather hazy. It has deep aromas from the malts and esters. The malt is bready. There is a deep dried cherry aroma as well. It has some spices in the aroma that are perfume like. There are flavors of bready and some chocolate. There are flavors of dried cherries, plums, and floral elements. The overall flavor presentation is moderately sweet and moderately bitter. It has a moderate boyd with some noticeable alcohol warmth. It also has fairly high carbonation. The finish is also somewhat dry. Overall, there is a complex combinations of flavors and aromas provided by the malt and esters. The overall presentation starts moderately sweet with moderate bitterness and finishes dry with a slight bit of tartness.
Transferring from old rating system. I think I had on tap. Thats why maybe my notes were on a low level.
@ Eddan 16-12-3: en lätt och len öl med små toner av kola. Annars lite blek tycker jag.

Bottle from Systembolaget, bought in 2012. Hazy amber with a small head. Aroma and taste of malt, some dried fruit, caramel and some hints of chocolate. The body was fairly thick and the finish with warming alcohol.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Dark fruit, spiced rum, caramel, lightly toasted malts, and slivovitz
Adjunct: Strong plum aroma, caramel, raisin, currants, and sweet malt; dark reddish amber with a thin creamy, light tan, head; medium bodied, silky and smooth with some warmth

Bottle. Pours brown/ dark amber with small beige head. Aroma; Sweetish, almonds, dark berries, weak roast, smooth alcohol, banana, vanilla. Taste: medium sweet, caramel, toffee, chocolate, spicy, smooth alcohol. Full body. Sweet finish.

Flaska från Galatea, privatimport. Provning med Nerikes Ölsällskap, tema amerikanska tungviktare, del II. Flaska från augusti, 2014. Mahognybrun med litet vitbeiget skum. Söt, maltig doft med mycket torkad frukt, övermogna äpplen, lite nötiga inslag, en aning boozy, kandisocker. Något större i kroppen. Söt men inte supersöt. I smaken framträder lite mer rostade och lätt syrliga toner som balanserar upp sötman fint. Tung, maltig, men samtidigt elegant. Känns som den jämnat ut sig något av åldern.

750 ml bottle from Hawthorne Cellars. Pours orange-amber with very small cream-coloured head. Aroma is yeast and dark fruit. Flavours are dark fruit over a malty base. A bit less fermentation than I would like, but otherwise very, very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Bottle. This is a great belgian style ale with lots of candy sugar sweetness and dark fruits layered across the warm malty foundation.

BOTTLE. Amber pour with no real head yet laces the glass well.. Oaky tones, toffee, malt & warmth on the nose.. Smooth malt body, sweet toffee malt, some cork aroma??, spices & dried fruit are faint.. Sourced Cape Cellars

Finally getting to try this one, aromas of booze soaked raisins and plums, sweet caramel malts abound. Flavor is much the same, the alcohol isnt as noticeable as you would think, the flavors meld together nicely.
Dark amber, hazy, with a little cream-colored head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and spices. Spicy with a bit of tartness. Smooth creamy feel. Pretty nice.
A very nice brew, opened for a littlebit of a special occasion. The whole company did enjoy this one.
Draft. Pours amber orange with a white head. Rich Belgian yeasty base, peach and marmalade-like fruity notes, some caramel, and light baking spice. Sweet and yeasty finish. Good stuff.

Backlog bottle shared from 2014. Sweet nose with caramelized fruit, apricot, prune and cooked apples. Cacao on the palate with some spice. Sweet, but drier towards the finish. Light body for the abv. Soft mouthfeel. Tasty.
Bottle at cropredy 2016 day 3....thanks to Fin Dark brown.. Thin tan.. Soft sweet toffee fruit.. Bready fruits .. Soft juicyy fruit.. Soft toffee fruit.. Rich bready

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie we had this at Fairports Annual Reunion Festival, Cropredy Saturday 13th August 2016   Pours copper with an off-white head. This is soft in the mouth, very easy drinking. A tiny bit metallic on the nose but with some spice and sweaty leather. Chocolate a bit of leather and tobacco and some caramel a bit bready and with spice again, smooth and pleasant but I wouldnt get too excited, its nice. A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13 3.4
Pours a clear redish-brown. A strong deal fruit malt aroma. A strong prune, raisin, dark fruit malt and caramel taste. A lingering sweet dark fruit malt aftertaste, but not too sour or strong.
Bottle. Pours a clear reddish brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, and a little booze.

750 ml bottle at Staffan47, thanks! Brownish amber with off white head. Aroma has ripe fruits, bready biscuity malt, slight vinous notes and slight spice. Taste is medium sweet without being cloying, dark caramel, dried fruits, plums, bready biscuity malts and spice. Very nice.

Draft at the source on 6/30/2016. Clear dark copper with a light beige head. Aroma of dark fruit, plum, cherry notes, Belgian yeast, spice. Taste is dark fruits, caramel, spice, and nuts. Finish is a bit sweet.

Scent of fruitiness and spices. Dark fruit, lightly spiced, caramel and raisins in a little scent. Okay bitter, almost a little sour and fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Had higher expectations of this beer. OK to drink. Bottled 1 August 2014. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Very sweet candy like flavor. Almost a barley wine. Reddish colored. Had at brewery
Deep, rich, complex. Caramel, dark and dried fruits, spices, bread. Finishes sweet but not cloying.
Pours copper with almost no lacing. Smell is plum. Taste is velvety smooth with a little sweet finish. Wonderful beer
Bottle. Hazy orange, off-white head. Caramel and dried fruits aroma, yeasty. Caramel sweet flavour, fruity, hoppy , yeasts. Great body

Friday. A large, strong bottle of beer while the wife and I go over house plans. Her strategy of getting some changes made that might very well work. Hard to resist a strong Belgium.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bomber to glass; not a ton of experience in this style but will be trying more - one word; caramel - that was prevalent everywhere and I enjoyed it; not much dark fruit. will try again.
750ml bottle pours out a amber color topped with a tan head. Nose is a nice belg sweetness pit fruit vanilla and a heavy malt. Taste is toffee caramel pit fruit sweetness and nice belg yeast notes.

75cl bottle shared with friends. Clear reddish brown with a small white head. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Caramel, malts, raisins, ripe fruits, spices and herbs. Good brew.

Bottle: (2013 Vintage)
Cloudy brown with a thin, off-white cap.
Toffee and plum aroma.
Dark, sweet bread, plums, toffee malt taste.
Sticky caramel/chocolate/nuttiness.
Sort of like a slightly boozy candy bar...
Just gets better and better the more you taste and the warmer it gets.
NICE.

750 mL. Brownish orange with quickly dissipating orangish head. Ripe banana, under ripe strawberry, belgian yeast, clove and banana bread. Bready sweet flavor with a mild spice aftertaste. Medium body with a watery feel.

Dark red body with a creamy head.
Aroma and flavours of dried fruit and spicy belgian yeast. Moderetely sweet with light bitterness. Somewhat sharp taste, with a bit of alcohol.
Medium body with soft carbonation

This is a good belgian strong ale, but I expected more from AleSmith. There is no reason to return to this beer considering the alternatives from Belgium.
Bottle. Nutty toffee malt, yeast, and dry grass aroma. Chestnut with small head. Sweet raisin, pecan, toffee malt and moderately bitter herbal hay/alcohol flavor. Nice body.
Deep orange, ruddy pour, small off white head. Fantastic aroma, dried fruits and spices. Flavor is still fruity but takes on a roasty character. Perhaps a bit thin.
Sampled at ESBLS. Amber with a beige ring. A grain and perfume aroma. Flavor is funky and earthy. Grainy. Dark fruit and stone fruit. Nice.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown with no head. The aroma is dark fruit, raisin, toast. Thin mouth, sweet fruit, toffee, touch of hop bitterness, light spice finish, very good.
From a bottle. Mild rum and raison aroma, delicious and well balanced, not usually my favourite style but this was great.

Draft at Bru Craft. Clear mahogany brown pour with no head at all. Plummy dark red fruit. Fairly juicy and very sweet but with a bit of spice on the end. Raisin brandy flambee. Glossy chocolate liquorice. Black currants. Homemade root beer. Vegemite. Anchovies. Worcestershire sauce. Merlot. Celery root. Bamboo shoots. Shittake mushrooms. Oyster sauce. Dark caramel toffees. The alcohol feels more prominent as it warms. Medium syrupy body. More complex than expected. Definitely a sipper.

Strong raisiny prune like aroma, with Belgian yeasty spice. Bread 
Pours a murky brownish Amber color with small disappearing off white head
Prune and raisin bread like flavor, hint of cocoa, yeasty spice, slight bitterness.
Medium bodied with medium co2, lingering sweet yeasty spice finish.
Another winner from Alesmith. Interesting and delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled from Systembolaget bought a few years ago
Murky brown with a small, tan head. 
Metallic arma with sweet spiciness. Pomerance and coriander. 
Vinous flavour with notes of liquorice.
Bomber to a pint. Clear mahogany brown with off white head. Fruity esters and spicy phenols for sure. Clove and banana notes. Some chocolate on the finish. Really good brew.

Rating #1543 - 20.03.2015 - Birthday Brew Tour - On tap @ Alesmith. Dark brown pour with a bubbly tan head, decent retention.heavy on carbonation Aroma is quite fruity. Full bodied. Creamy mouthfeel. Taste is ripened peaches, currant, raisin, spiciness. Extremely smooth finish and a lingering taste of sweet malt. Superb.
Bottle. Chestnut brown pour with an off-white head. Aroma is fruity, bready, yeasty. Taste is a little candy, bread, fruit. Quite nice for the style.

Bottle from Belgium. Copper color, beige head. Bittersweet taste with citrus, toffee, yeast, caramel, nuts, raisins and malts. Bittersweet finish with citrus, toffee, nuts, yeast and malts. Exquisite Belgian strong.

appearance: deep clear copper, short creamy light tan head shrinking quickly.  aroma: treacle, toffee, raisin, plum, caramel, candi sugar.  taste: brown sugar, caramel, raisin, plum, raspberry, light chocolate, hint of leather, candi sugar, yeast, candied orange. finish: 	light booze, lots of sweetness, fruity and sugary.  notes: 	Big, sweet, malty, a little fruity, with well-hidden alcohol for the abv. Nice. Bottle from Sarah for Beerdvent 2015.
Bomber shared with the fellas....taste of caramel toffee raisins dark fruits and little Belgian yeast...a tad of chocolate comes in late....solid brew.
Tap at alesmith, san diego. Dark mahogany brown color, tanned head. Sweet nose, cherries, fruits, some oak. Sweet balanced body, sweet fruits, some hops on the back. Long sweet finish.

bottle @ Jungle Jims / Eastgate OH --- Clear amber brown color, beige head that drops to a solid cover, Taste is full-bodied caramel malt that moves through a lightly fizzed swallow, then turns toward bitter-sweet caramel to achieve balance. A sweet breww overall, but very well done.
Bottle in the hotel. Pours clear amber, nose is toffee, caramel, vanilla, malty, taste is similar, sweet, dry, bitter.

750 ml bottle. Pours a veiled orange hazelnut brown with a short lived white head. Aroma is sweet, brown sugar, spice. Flavor is brown sugar, caramel, hazelnut. Finish is herbal, slightly oldish. Boozy notes. Medium to full body, velvety mouthfeel and weak to average carbonation.

bottle. Deep amber with one finger head. Big body. Fairly sweet with dark fruit, toffee. Just a hint of belgian spicing. On the boozy side. Slightly underwhelming -- Alesmith makes some kickass beers, this doesnt seem to be one of them.

On draft at When Pigs Fly in Kittery. This beer is determined to throw every flavor, aroma, and ester that it can at you. The aroma is malty and fruity, and the flavor is strong stone fruit, bread, and Belgian yeast character. Theres so much going on here that I found it hard to separate all of the flavors and keep everything straight. This is a good representation of a Belgian Strong Ale and definitely worth trying.

pours unclear dark copper, orange tint, with a very nice reviving light beige cap, nice lacing. toasted fruity and spicy maltiness, orange spicy fruitiness, brown sugar and demerara, soft leather and woodsy notes, very yeasty, pepper. bright to moderate carbonation, light to medium body, semi-sweet and spicy-peppery finish. solid medium dark belgian.

Bottle 2011. Pour is dark copper with a medium tan head. Aroma and flavor of oak, bitter hops, raisins, nuts, and yeast. Finish is a bit thin with dark fruit and yeast coming through the most. May be past its prime.

Pours a dark golden brown color with tangerine edges and a two finger off-white head that slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Streaks of soapy lacing left behind.

Sweet, slightly spicy aroma with prominent dark fruit esters and dark malt sweetness. Slightly herbal and medicinal with a touch of cough syrup, pepper and clove. Vinous fruit sweetness with grape, fig and raisin. Some Belgian candi sugar in there with caramel malt sweetness, toffee and toast.

Fuller end of medium body with a more complex flavor profile than the nose hinted at. Soft carbonation with a nice balance of peppery spice, herbal/syrupy flavor, vinous fruit and dark malt sweetness. Peppery with some clove and faint piney hops. Very sweet and vinous with prominent fruity esters, notably grape, fig, raisin and other dark berries. Also, theres some dark malt sweetness with hints of chocolate, caramel and toffee. Nicely balanced and the high ABV is excellently masked making beer a bit too easy to drink. Would never have guessed it was 10%.

Pours clear copper with thin tan head. Nose is fruits, caramel, honey. Aromas are toasted malts, dark fruits, nuts, some butter and whisky notes. Average carbonation, medium body. Long bitter butterish finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Maroon body, white head, not much retention. Poured into chalice. dried fruit, raisin, sweet yeast aroma. Taste is sweet, malty. Similar to a quad. Decent.

A little sour with raisin flavor. Not the best. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Limpido color ambrato con un bel cappello di schiuma beige. Aroma fruttato e fortemente caramellato, note pungenti e un po fenoliche; gusto mediamente rotondo, dolciastro, note di zucchero caramellato e un lieve tocco metallico nel finale. Meno corposa dellatteso, frizzante, non eccessivamente morbida. Sinceramente mi aspettavo di più.

sample, notes. dark copper amber colour slight hazy with a tanned head. nose of caramel malts, raisins, bread, and caramel biscuits. cloves and some dark forrest fruits in the back. fudgie, with some vanilla notice. nice.

Aroma of dark fruits, spicy dark bread, toffee, caramel. Flavors has much of the same. Spicy sweet malt, slight coffee, caramel, toffee and nice dark fruits. Quite good, but nothing out of the ordinary.
Nearly clear amber copper. Smells malty. Loads and loads of banana in a great way. Tasted at Elijah Ps Monsters of Beer festival.

Backlog rating. Keg at BD Shoreditch, London. It pours a dark copper color with a medium tan head. Aroma is sweet and lightly boozy. Light roasted notes, dark fruits, caramel, prunes, dates and toffee. Taste has more roasted malts, cocoa, toffee, dark fruits and burnt sugar. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, bold
Aromas of plum, alcohol, clove, apple, caramel. Clear red-bronze with a mostly lasting off-white head. A little sweet, fruity, raisiny, pretty clean. Full bodied, warming.

Aromas of bananas, some clove, tart berries and some peanuts. Light off white bubbly head and dark red body. Flavors of berries and floral grassy notes and light spices. Smooth and slightly carbonated on the palate.
Tap at ox cart. Light brown with small head. Really nice candy nose. Roasted, some fruit, oily. Super mouthfeel. Alcohol. Bubble gum. Balance is great. Finish is fast. Great beer.

Clear, brownish-red beer with an off-white head and a fruity aroma which lives up to the strength. Flavour is dried fruit, earthy malts, caramel, chocolate. Distinct but balanced brilliantly. Lingering fruity aftertaste and its pleasingly rich in body too. Great stuff.
750ml->tulip. Dark amber with huge lite tan head. A: dark fruit, spices, caramel, candied sugar. T: spices, dark fruit, caramel, toffee. Sweet and syrupy. Decent but not a star for the style.
Fig, currant, yeast and candi nose. Clear copper brown, thin tan head. Caramel and nougat initially, cherries and figs appear at midpalate and stay awhile. Medium body, moderate carbonation, warm.

Aroma: banana, caramel, alcohol, raisin, 
Appearance: clear amber, off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, caramel, dark fruits
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious
Belgian yeast going on in aroma with some fruity esters there. Flavor is f some real set but not much, mostly yeasty fruity character with some dried fruits such as raisins. Full body lots o favors.

Taster at the brewery. Brown-copper color with fine beige ring. Raisins, prunes, not sweet! A hint of coffee, some spices, dried fruits. A bit booze in the end, just a little bit warming. Silky mouthfeel. Superbly balanced, feels lighter than youd expect.
Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy dark brown with an off white foam. Toffee with raisins and prune juice. Lemon cheesecake with coconut. Grapefruit with oranges and spices. Very good.
750ml bottle. Brown color with beige head. Malty aroma, caramel, dark fruits, light spicy, some chocolate. Sweet and light bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at Leightons wedding get together. From Brewdog online. Aroma is funky, bit sweaty, sweet candy sugars , dried fruit, light spices. Flavour is composed of semi sweet honey nutty, dried orange rind, dried fruit, cinnamon. Palate is semi sweet, highish carbonation. Really good.

June 21, 2015. Bottle at home, bought in 2013. 
Light hazy reddish brown with a medium sized dense off-white head. Aroma is sweet with caramel, dark sugars, raisins, pear, licorice and light spicy. Taste is sweet caramel, dried fruits, pear and slight nutty and spicy notes. Finish is sweet fruity and dark sugars with warming alcohol. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation.
Bottle @ share. Deep Amber with a small head. Very estery. Plum, soaps, peach. Concorde grapes and hints of toffee. Taste is strong caramel and toffee. Loads of sweet fruits. Syripy and rich. Solid.
Very, very nice. Think of this as Quad-lite. Solid quad characteristics all the way, but just a bit lighter all the way around.

Served on tap at Alesmith. Amber color white head. Sweets let aroma. Heavy body. Alcohol, sweet, and plum flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at bar. Shared with Meilby. Poured a light brown with white head. Nose has prune, raisins and sweet chocolate, slight Grand Marnier. Taste is tickling the throat, sweet and delicious. Low carbonation. Clean palate with lingering liqueur notes. Excellent

Bottle shared with friend. Pours a brownish red with a small off-white head that stays for long. Big toffee, malty, vanilla, banana candy aroma. Flavour is pretty much the same, big sweetness, malty, banana, yeasty. Big mouthfeel, chewy, with a long and nice aftertaste. Good stuff!
Ölföreningens julölsprovning 2014. Smak och doft av torkad frukt, malt, brunt socker, honung. Fruktig, rund och len, välbalanserad, komplexa smaker, fin beska. Gott!
Bottle. Pours a transparent amber with a thin layer of light tan head. Aroma of caramel, sugar, dark fruits. Taste is very smooth, caramel, some vanilla, slight booze.
medium dark red brown. Aroma cherries markers, brown sugar. Tastes raisins grapes light grains. Creamy palate.

0.75 bottle with 10.0% ABV. Clear, crimson color and a medium, off-white head leaving no lacing. Sweet, complex aroma of toast, nuts, yeasts, butter, caramel, fruits, and a delicate vanilla. Taste is full of malts, spices, again vanilla, some Belgian yeasts, subtle hints of alcohol, candied fruits - complex and ravishing. Medium body, oily texture, and average carbonation. Finish is still sweet although drier, introduces chocolate, more malts, esters lose potency but also become more refined, alcohol can be felt only delicately. All things considered, this is a phenomenal beer - certainly worth recommendation.

Bottle thanks to Ibrew2or3 shared at Anchorage Apr 15 Tasting: Poured brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, yeast esters, sweet caramel malt, and light vanilla. Alcohol burn hits you at first with caramel malts and toasty finish.

dark brown colour with reddish notes, 1 inch slightly yellowish off-white head; aroma of herbal notes, raisin, belgian yeast, caramel, hints of apple, spicy and slight alcoholic notes; taste of syrupy sweetness which is perfectly ballanced by bitterness, and supported by raisin and herbal notes as well as spicy alcohol;full bodied Belgian Strong Ale
31.12.2014. Clear dark amber or cherry color. Aroma of yeast, dried fruits, cherry, alcohol. Taste is smoorh, soft carbonation, sophisticated, cherry, bittersweet, malts.

Best gran cru poured reddish brown, notes of caramel and yeast dough, rich dark fruits, and some very little wine Cabernet notes. Flavor is perfect balance of richness and dryness. Excellent mouthfeel with a finish if complex Belgian characteristics! Perfect.

At Mad for Beer pub in Rome - Italy. Bottle. Courtesy of mortlach. Pours cloudy dark amber, frothy ivory head. Nose: syrup, caramel, honey. Mouth: big character, consistent, honey forward, medium-low carbonation. Far too sweet but lovely. Thank you mortlach. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very fine brew with full body. Caramels, vanilla, vineous notes and sweet fruits like grape, raisin and plum. Mostly sweet but not overly, quite balanced and complex. I can drink this any day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[2/19/15] Draught at Alesmith in San Diego. Nice clear reddish amber. Nice aroma of cookies, caramel, malt, some fruitiness and a spicy hint. Sweet flavor with caramel, fruitiness, a spicy hint and alcohol. Medium-bodied.
Bottle from Voldby Købmandsgaard - brown/sienna coloured pour with off-white head. Sweet malty aroma and taste, caramel, toffee, dark dried fruits, some spices, hides the abv well.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours reddish brown with an off-white head. Slightly sweet roasted taste of toffee, yeast, chocolate notes, alcohol. Full body. Low carbonation. Nice slightly roasted finish.
Bottle. Color is deep orange with frothy khaki head. Aroma of orange peel and caramel. Taste is sweet thick toffee. Lots of sticky brown sugar malt.
Bottle. Chestnut red brown with tan head. Aroma of dried fruit, raisin, prune, dates. Taste of caramel, toffee, dried fruit. Sweet and quite bitter.
Tap at BrewDog Nottingham. Pour is amber with no head, aroma is fruity, caramel, strong alcohol. Taste is sweet, fruity, caramel, alcohol. Excellent

Bottle from citybeer in SF. Dark reddish brown with off white head. Head dissipated pretty quickly. Aromas of cherries, brandy, toffee, caramel; similar flavours. Tastes like an AleSmith. Probably my favourite from all the brought back from SF.

Draft, Brew Dog Birmingham, really well constructed barley wine style, quiet alcoholic on the taste, but with enough malt and hop to keep it balanced. Lots going on throughout start to finish, very well put together
Wish I had more. Opera pour with minimal white head. Aroma and taste are sweet toffee, cherry and apple. Great beer.
Bomber thanks to RespertFTW. Dark copper with a large, beige head. Mild toffee and grape aromas. Vanilla and grape.

Keg at Brewdog, Shepherds Bush, London. A copper coloured pour with a thin off white head on top. Sweet, caramel, dark fruit aroma. Tastes sweet, caramel, yeasty, dark fruit. Quite Belgian in character.

Keg at Brewdog. Dark brick red, small ring of white head. Aroma is a bit weird - Im mostly getting broccoli or kale. Body is medium, slightly foamy, medium carbonation. Taste is like a sour brown initially, white bread, big sweet toffee malt, no alcohol presence. Certainly very drinkable for the ABV.
Pours a dark reddish brown with a thin white head. Smell is alcohol up front. Peppery spices taste.

Tap. Brewdog, Leeds. Clear, dark copper. Off white head, most of which sticks to the glass. Soft, red fruit, light spicy malts. White chocolate. Hint of cassis in there. Quite heady. Taste is cherry chocolate sweet, turning spicy dry. Body is medium to full. A bit boozy. Finishes boozy sweet, turning spicy dry. Heady stuff. Nice one.
Bue à la pression. Ambrée foncée, arômes de caramel et de vanille bien équilibrés. Alcool bien dosé, finale plutot sèche et équilibrée.

Flaska från Brill via SB drucken med ölföreningen. Provade först en 2011 som var lite sur och smakade kartong. Bytte den mot en färsk som var mycket trevligare. Söt lätt syrlig stor belgisk strong ale i US-tappning. Söta estriga smaker av kanderad frukt och smågodis men med en massiv kropp som fyller ut och rundar estrigheten riktigt bra. Mandelmassa, honung, torkad frukt. Sedan en lätt körsbärsyrlighet med lite kärnbeska och en aning färskt trä. Komplex och riktigt god.
Poured from a bottle it is a dark cherry amber with a slight head the aroma is a strong sherry and the taste is a bitter sweet taste that resonates cherry

750mL 2012. Au nez, on sent le jus de pomme brute, le caramel et noisettes. En bouche, on goute le grain, les noix, les amandes, le caramel, les micro-bulles et la poussière! En finale, on goute un sucre brun, caramélisé, bonbons à la réglisse noir (légèrement) et le sucre dorge... Un très beau vieillissement!

On tap at TJs. Dark reddish brown pour, tan head. Caramel, cherry, apple, cereal, orange peel, toast, banana, alcohol. Moderately sweet. Lightly bitter and tart. Full bodied with a little carbonation. Excellent sipper.

Aroma has plums, vanilla, pear, caramel malts, belgian yeast. Pours hazy fark brown color, minimal head, beautiful lacing. Taste has heavy sweetness that turns into medium bitterness, alcohol is present. Full body, minimal carbonation. Overall an excellent beer.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 75cl bottle served in a Prearis glass. Pours a wonderful translucent dark brown colour with a bubbly off white head which lasts well. Aroma is spicy, yeasty and dark fruits. Taste is hugely complex with sweet fruit preserve, toffee and malty spiciness giving way to a late bitterness. Medium mouthfeel but perfect for the style with good carbonation. Exactly what you would expect for a Belgian style beer brewed the American way. All the subtleness and well balanced flavours of a Belgian ale cranked up to 11.

fantastic and easy drinking. bready, molasses aroma. taste is of fruitcake, candied dark fruits, marzipan, caramel apple, and chocolate covered orange peel. slight citrusy aroma and taste from the yeast. not extremely yeasty, but not very dark-malt dominated either. very complex and interesting beer. strong, but still displays a light character, ie., not overly sticky, toasted, alcoholic, hoppy, or wine-y.

Bottle bought through brill & Co. Pours goldenish brown with a creamy frothy goldenish offwhite head that leaves some thick trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and slightly estery with oatmeal, caramel, baked pears, apples, marzipan, dry soil, hay and lemon zest. Taste is slightly sweet, slightly bitter, malty and estery with oatmeal, caramel, toffee, apples, pears, marzipan, soil, hay, lemon zest and alcohol. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny tart and near full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, tiny sour, malty and estery with oatmeal, bread, apples, pears, hay, dry soil and lemon zest. Nicely balanced!

On tap at their tasting room. Pours a clear copper with a thin tan head. Aroma is caramel raisins. Flavor follows and is really sweet. Dark fruits. Some slight tartness on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piwo dobre z rangi Grand Cru, ale wydaje mi sie ze takie nie jest. Elegancka butelka lakierowana cacy ale srednia i opadajaca blyskawicznie pianka. Alkohol naszczescie ukryty. Kolor bordowy ale Grand Cru z Belgii to inna klasa. W smaku sliwka porzeczki nieco malim i powidel sliwkowych, do tego such piernik i rodzynki w rumie.

light beige head leaves minimal lacing. red brown colour. aroma is toffee, caramel, raisins, figs, dates, yeasty, bit peppery. taste is really rich toffee, caramel, raisins, figs, dates, marmelade aftertaste is sweet but also a bitterness like roasted malts. medium body and carbonation. very enjoyable sipper. bottle 75cl

750ml bottle @jookos, thanks! Copper color, thin white head. Alcohol soaked dried fruits in aroma, raisins. Flavor has bready malt, dark fruits, sweetness, raisins and plums. Heavy stuff. Quite boozy.

Pours a crystal clear body (i.e. served properly, according to the commercial description) with a medium amber colour. The head is rather small, has the colour of eggnog and laces the glass well. Sweet, malty and quite strong aroma of dark dried fruits, sweet caramel, Belgian yeast and wood. Strong flavour of dark dried fruits (prunes), generic fresh fruits, brown sugar and liquorice. Moderate sweet taste with a moderate bitter long-lasting finish. Full-bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A good one, but for the first time when tasting a beer from AleSmith I cant claim that its one of the best beers Ive ever had. 
[75 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika, shared with Svensenga smak & behag]

Aroma: intense caramel, heavy bread and grain malts. Appearance: clear amber, small, white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets intensify, prunes, overripe fruits, heavy caramel. Overall: very nice Belgian Strong Ale, great aroma. Pint at AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego.

Rød klar farge. Lukter bær og frukt og karamell. Kaffelikørsmak. Syrlig lang ettersmak.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, newish vintage. Reddish brown. Belgy dubbel- like yeastyness, dark bread malts, clove, spices on nose. Full bodied, soft, tasty. Dark bready, dark nutty, estery, herby. A lot going on here, definitely not a boring pour. Well carbonated, feels like quite a light digestion, hard to believe the abv printed on the bottle. Interesting, sort of a light textured, complex, dubbel. With a lot of abv.

Bottled, 2011 vintage. Deep ruby color, thin soapy head. Complex and delicate aroma of an aged beer. Lots of dried fruits like dates and raisins, sour cherries, acidic red currants, a touch of herbs. A hint of chocolatey malts too, maybe a hint of vanilla. Slightly caramelly flavor, loads of dried fruits(almost woody). Dry, berryish and acidic finish with dark chocolate and caramel. Berryish/leathery late aftertaste. Medium body, lots of carbonation but it works. Very well aged and delicious.

750 ml bottle. 2013 vintage. Hazy orange amber color with lasting head retention. Aroma is damn fine. Belgian candy sugar, dried fruits, raisins, figs and yeast. 
The flavor is Just and nice as the aroma. Tons of dried fruits and candy sugar up front followed by a nice thick yeasty character. Shows some raisin and dates in the finish. The alcohol is not found much in the flavor but does after the nice warming sensation after the swallow. Overall, for and American made Belgian brew this is really impressive.

This is a great beer. 1300! Pours brown, clear lots of head minimal lacing. Nose is vanilla and toffee. Flavours of same plus maybe some tobacco, some fruit plums plums some tangyness. Taste is med/light sweet light bitter. Medium somewhat creamy body with medium carbonation. Alcohol well hidden, dangerously drinkable for strength.

from 750mL, 2-3 years old

Really cloudy brown red pour with very little beige head. Deep but smooth sour scent; cherry, apple, and dark fruits. Tar-y molasses, carmel and cinnamon as well. Soft carbonation, mouthfeel is slightly acidic but thick, astringent finish. Boozy flavor, some peat and brown sugar or molasses, yeast wheatiness, banana esters. Very strong, malt-forward belgian with wine scotch/scottish ale elements. A little watery, may have been better with less age.
Dark reddish brown pour, sour malt scent. Taste of scotch malt with caramel and chocolate.

Butelka 75cl. 
I tasted the beer and wrote a big damn notice about it, then the page refreshed and it was gone ... Anyway the beer is really good. A good body and mouthfeel. Taste is well balanced and the alcohol warming.

Bear in mind that although I love Belgian style beers, I detest anything thats hop forward in its profile. That said, AleSmith Grand Crus flavor begins with a touch of caramel, which almost immediately gets overwhelmed by a grapefruit-like sourness. This, in turn, gives way to a bitter, dry hoppy flavor that lingers long after youve swallowed the beer. Given the very high ratings, perhaps I got a bad bottle, but Im in no hurry to ever drink this beer again.

Clear ruby brown with a small off white head, fading quickly. Faint spicy aromas with some nutmeg and light clove. Light carbonation, velvety palate, nutmeg, light herbal notes, caramel finale. Pretty easy drinking for the style. Alcohol very well-hidden.

Drank 16-8-2014 on a tasting with Thierry, Marijn, Tijs, Rik, Lennart and Bram during our holiday in the Ardennen. Compelling, grabbing taste. Sweet, with a strong and dominating alchol taste. Nice sweet finish. Light brown color with a bit yellow foam.
750 ml bottle dated 1/8/14 poured into a tulip..beautiful burgundy color with fluffy off-white head..taste of caramel,toffee,spices..alcohol is there but not in your face..outstanding.

750mL Champagne bottle Bottled on 04/02/14
Darker than expected with a clear amber body & medium sized creamy white head that holds.
Plenty of spicy, clovey, peppery phenolic character on the nose; pear esters, fragrant floral notes combining with toffee & toasty malts.
Full body, good creamy carbonation, doesnt give away too much of that big abv straight away.
Yeasty character takes hold again on the palate; white pepper, ripe pear and bananas, clove & cinnamon, bread dough, herbal hops with a backbone of pale toffee sweetness. Dry finish, moderate bitterness, a touch of booze warmth lingers.
Nice enough Belgian, not amongst the top of the style, but still darn nice.
Had this at a fantastic tasting and had such a great time with great people and great beers!
didnt find this all that interesting, sort of forgettable after a few sips. not bad, just not very exciting.
carried over from untapped to try and organize my beers for syncronicitys sake.

2013 bottling of this brown beauty with gold highlights, creamy tan head and spare, fine carbonation. Silky texture gives up classic Belgian style dark fruits like date and raisin. Caramelly and warming. A bit of dryness, pale-fruit tang and winey acidity balance it out, quite a fully realized rendition in the aroma and taste and palate.

Dates, aged cheese, port in the aroma. Same in the taste. Plus caramel 
and alcohol. Very good overall

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2015 Luxury beer from this reputed American craft brewery, bottled in champagne bottles and apparently brewed with a Belgian trappist yeast strain. Dense, sticky, yellowish head over a warm bronze beer with a reddish glow, misty. Complexely perfumed with honey, apple sauce, apricot, tea leaves, candi sugar, hazelnuts, orange peel, plums, dried leaves, raisins, nutmeg. Sweet candi and fruity onset of which the candi syrup accent will guide you through the complete flavour trail; in the middle a big caramelly, nutty and honeyish maltiness, emphatic yeasty spiciness (there we have it) and a peppery hoppiness, which, in the end, gets the company of a warming alcohol effect reminiscent of amaretto and cognac, but not to a degree where it becomes disturbing. Great beer, just a little bit too cloying for me.

Bottle sample at Grand Cru tasting at Beer and Beyond shop. Almost clear amber with a small white head. Yeasty and phenolic aroma with malt and caramel in the background. Sweet with prunes, caramel malt, vanilla, light chocolate and spicy notes. Heavy but well balanced flavors. Medium-bodied, lively carbonation. Nice.

This rich beautiful brown amber has the aroma of banana walnut muffins. It has that typical Belgian yeasty flavor. It finishes smooth and clean. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very smooth. Like it. Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxx

Had on tap as well as a bottle. One thing I like about this beer is that the Belgian yeast survives the High abv which is something I really appreciate. a bit fruity without being citrus like a pale ale. Alcohol warms but does not burn. Caramel Sweet from start to finish

Hmm...been drinking and going to Alesmith for years now and somehow never rated this. Growler fill from brewery today. Pours a nice tea color (red-brown) with one full finger of frothy off-white foam. AROMA is yeasty and spicy with notes of caramel, dark bready malts, dark grapes/raisins, port, and cloves. FLAVOR of excellent dark fruit (dates, plums, raisins), Belgian yeast (hints of banana and clove), delicious caramel, candi sugar, and buttered toast (whole wheat bread). A very pleasing level of moderate sweetness. Smooth and somewhat dry finish. The high ABV is completely hidden here. Yet another excellent beer by the fine folks at Alesmith. (1021, 870)
Bottle shared at May Ale Alpharetta. Aroma was yeast, raisin, bits of banana esters, thick caramel maltiness. Taste has spicy caramel maltiness, dark fruits, estery yeast. Not much carbonation. Nice.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy ruby coloured with spicy red fruity flavours, sherry, vanilla and oak notes with a very warming burnt currant and toffee finish.

Bottle from a trade and shared at the bottle share. Small snifters. Pours a medium brown, clear with a small eggshell head and mild lacing. Aroma is complex with Belgian yeasts, dark fruits such as prunes and plums, a subtle sweetness, caramel, and spices. The taste is just as complex with Belgian yeasts, sweet dark sugars, dark fruits, caramel, vanilla, spices such as cloves and anise. Medium body, mild carbonation. Finish is full of flavor and Belgian yeasts. Very enjoyable.

Purchased at Woodmans in Kenosha, WI; enjoyed at home two days before leaving on a long European journey. This stuff looks, smells, and tastes fancy. Appearance a dark brown plum with a moderate off white head that rims around the glass, looks great in a chalice. Aroma is a nice complex mix of caramel, Belgian ale yeast, chocolate, raisin, vanilla, and light champagne. Taste is rich and flavorful and impressively light, considering the high ABV. The raisin flavor comes out more the warmer it gets, and it also becomes more enjoyable as it warms. Opened a bottle for myself, kind of wish I shared this one. Meant to be shared, really nice one.

Appearance: Clear copper/ruby with thin beige head.
Aroma: Raisin, chocolate, treacle, dried date, liquorice, aniseed, note of vanilla.
Taste: Medium sweetness, low/medium bitter and sourness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture, medium body, average carbonation, lingering dry, treacle, liquorice, aniseed, vanilla hint, dried date finish with alcohol warmth.
Comments: lovely. Rating is for bottled version 10%  ABV.
Ruckus Pizza Morrisville on draft. First try on draft. Very delicious. Maybe one of the best Belgians Ive tried in a while.

Bottle. Pours a reddish brown color with a moderate light tan head on it. Nose is sour with a fair amount of fruitiness to it and a slight bit of booze. Interestingly, I got got a quick whiff of candied sugar. Taste is strong and slightly sour with some whiskey to it, actually. Interesting, but not my style.

200 ml from a bottle thanks to a guy at BeerTemple. Clear deep amber pour with bubbly off white head. Aroma is really malty, nice mix of Alesmith malt :fruits, molasses, raisins and classic Belgian spicy notes, cinnamon, coriander, black pepper. Taste is sweet, malty, but with little residual sweetness. Palate is med-full bodied with good carbonation. Really easy drinking. Lives up to the Alesmith reputation.
Golden brown in color... Aroma of candi sugar, caramel... Flavor is caramel, toffee, Belgian candi sugar, light citrus, hint of bitterness on palate... Lots of plum... Great beer

Pours clear reddish brown with a slight head that dissipates quickly, no lacing, this beer is not about the appearance. Wonderful aroma of red grapes, honey, vanilla, slight earthy notes. This is a very unique beer, I havent had anything like this before, almost like an Oud Bruin. Medium sweet, slightly sour, very little bitterness, and some spicy, fruity aspects, extremely clean finish. Even has kind of a red raspberry dimension to it, very interesting. I would get this again, very satisfying.
Aroma is belgian yeast and has a hint of booze. Flavors of vanilla, caramel that are deep and complex.
Bottle pours a dark brown with small tan head. Smells of brown sugar and dried plums along with a hint of spice. Taste is toffee, dark fruit and a hint of cloves. Absolutely sublime.
Bomber. Rich amber pour with minimal head. Raisin, caramel, mild chocolate. Mild yeast. This is excellent.
Strong alcoholic of alcohol. There is a strong flavor of caramel, alcohol, grapes, vanilla, light chocolate, and more. The flavor changes as it warms. Very satisfying.
Bottle (over a year old) to a trappist glass - rusty brown with a beige head. Has a champagne aroma and an initial smoked toffee taste. Hints of dark fruit (plum) and caramel. Medium body and smooth.

Color caoba algo turbio con espuma color crema. Aromas de frutas confitadas En boca es afrutada y dulce con un final suave y ligero, aunque el regusto es largo e igualmente afrutado y dulce. Muy rica.

750 ml bottle. Hazy reddish brown colour, thin light beige head. Sweetish aroma of dried fruits and caramel malt, with notes of spices and sour berries. The flavour is toasted malty, with berries and dried fruits, a little caramel sweetness, and a spicy finish with warming alcohol. Good stuff.
An amazing ale. Pours a rich toffee color.. Aromas are bubblegum, Belgian yeast, grapes. Flavors follow suit. This is an incredible beer.

Clear, dark red colour with an off white head. Strong, spicy and relatively sweet malty aroma with caramel, butter, cinammon, cloves, some vanilla. Medium body with low carbonation. Raisin, caramel, berries, toast, brown sugar, some vanilla in the warming flavour, alcohol is barely noticeable. Really nice.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein minimal trübes bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig süß, alkoholisch, belgische Hefe. Geschmack sehr malzig alkoholisch, fruchtig, würzig

This might be a little cold. Banana, a slight spicyness, a sweetness, maybe caramel or something, over a faint bread flavor. Alcohol is well hidden. This is certainly drinkable, but far from AleSmiths best.

Clear amber pour with a small head. Aromas of sweet malt, brown sugar, candied fruits, and caramel. Flavor is sweet malt predominantly with some dark fruit notes coming through in the finish. I was a bit surprised this beer wasnt bottle conditioned. Pretty good but not as complex as I was hoping for.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2014 Clear amber body, thick beige head. Caramel, vanilla, fruity aroma. Taste is sweet, balanced, alcohol is hidden well.

Pours a dark dirty copper with a thin off white ring. Aroma is sweet caramel malts, vanilla and earthy notes. Taste is raisin, vanilla, caramel and yeast. Nicely complex, been sitting for at least a year so not terribly boozy. Super nice. Happy Birthday to me!

Bit disappointing. Expected something near Belgian quad, thou got only Belgian sourness x)
ofc.. its high quality and drinkable brew, but.. Mostly malt background, some caramel, sour berries, alco quite noticeable. Yeast, some spices. Sweet with sourness, low bitterness. Not bad, drinkable, but quite thin for alesmith =]

Pours brown with small head, that dissappears fast. Aroma of malts, sweetness. Tastes a bit sour and salty. Carbonated barley wine / Belgian strong ale. Because of the sourness, I didnt like it too much.

Bottle shared by Ben, thanks! Pours clear dark amber with creamy off-white head. Aroma is caramel and bready malts, light booze, plums, dates, and Belgian yeast. Flavor is sweet bready malts, alcohol spice, dark fruit esters, light caramel, and floral yeasty notes; dry finish. Medium/full body and medium carbonation

From a bottle. Pours hazy copper red with a bubbly, frothy off white head. Tastes like mild raisins, light brown sugar and spices. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like mild raisins, dates, toffee, caramel, and alcohol, and a bit sour.

Decent beer but scoring low due to the fact it exploded on when opened. When I say exploded I do not mean a little overflow, I mean it was like a volcano erupting. So fast I the only thing I could do was let it do its thing. So I am just putting that warning out. Also the bottle was not that old.

Pours a dark mahogany brown with a nice java head. Nose is sweet and fruity with a good bit of malt. Taste is fruity and sweet like the nose and yeasty. Finish is somewhat woody and sweet . Quaff Score 7 / 10
Pours a red brown with a beige head and aroma of fruits and spices. Taste is of dried fruits, yeast, spices, and alcohol with a fruity finish. Nice Belgian

0,75l bottle from the flagship Alko. Pours cloudy brown with a low head. Aroma is malts, dark fruits and alcohol. Flavor is malts, caramel, dark fruits and alcohol. Pretty good, if not quite worth the price.

750 ml bottle thanks to Nisse666! Sampled on December 21, 2013.Think it was only marked 10% ABV, might have seen it wrong though.Thought I had rated this in the past, seems not.Clear reddish brown color, fizzy tan head. Sweet, milky, spicy, heavy scent. Sweet, fizzy, alcohol, spicy taste. Fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Very noticeabe alcohol and spices.

Big bottle from Denmark cons 2013-12-21 Göteborg
AP: wee hazy red wine coloured body, fizzy wee bubbly cream caramel colored head
AR: ripe grapes, wee yeasty, mango, alcholic notes
F: citrus, vinos, dry, pretty fizzy, ripe grapes

Bottle. Pour is clear ruby red with a thin tan head. Aroma is caramel malt, light spice, faint cocoa, and light brandy notes. Flavor is rich caramel malt up front which gives way to chocolate notes followed by light spice and maple. a little alcohol burn in the middle but not much. Also some light fruity notes in the finish. Really drinkable. Good stuff.

Vintage 2013. Une bouteille de 75 cl payée 9.99$ et partagée avec Stefan et Ricardo. Une robe ambrée qui scintille. Une petite tête mousseuse qui se transforme rapidement en anneau. Le nez est bien attaqué par une multitude de fruits. Outre les prunes et les raisins, je peux reconnaître des fruits du verger et des cerises légèrement acidulées. Le profil malté est alléchant avec ses notes de caramel foncé et ses légères notes chocolatées. Le liquide bien tempéré permet aussi lapparition dune pointe de vanille et dun parfum langoureux de réglisse. La bouche est ravissante, douce, pleinement fruitée, bien maltée et chaude avec une subtile touche de bois vanillée. Au palais, le liquide montre un corps de moyenne densité avec une texture presque liquoreuse et des bulles à la belge. La finale se fait sur des notes amères fabriquées par un alcool poivré, une levure fruitée, des malts rôtis et des houblons herbeux.

Lagrats i 2 år till en ljuvlig upplevelse. Världens bästa bryggeri levererar alltid 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle over a year old. A sweet belgian triple, some spice some banana. A belgiany belgian from san diego.

750mL bottle pours a deep amber almost brown, smells of applesauce and spice, some sweet caramel notes linger on the taste with a bit of bread crust in the finish. Solid beer but not my favorite from Alesmith
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: On tap at Stubbys. Clear copper with a thin white head. Aroma of cherries, oak, toffee, sweet malt and fruit. Tastes like liqueur/amaretto with fruit, oak, toffee and is overly cloying and unbalanced almost to the point that I dont even want to drink it.
From backlog. Dark amber colour. Caramel dark fruit aroma. Sweet, caramel, belgian yeast taste.

I think I got it at Jimbos. Its a cold foggy night. In an American pint glass. Smells like a real Belgium beer. Reddish color? Complex flavor. Tastes like a Belgium triple that I really like but cant place. St Bernardus 12 mixed with a little McChouffe. Really nice and thick in a good way.

2006 vintage- pours mahogany with a ruby undertone. Excellent clarity and small lacing and virtually no head. Nose- apple juice, raisins, burnt sugar. Taste- syrupy caramel, dark fruits and yeasty phenols. Overall the flavour profile is flabby likely due to oxidation. very low carbonation. Dry mineral finish.

Hazy dark toffee brown beer with a beige head. Raisins, sherry and sour red berries on the nose. Very interesting taste. Lingonberries with only slight sourness, sweet bread, toffee, yeast, ice latte. Medium body. An excellent ale with a unique twist.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a trappist glass. Pours translucent dark/medium brown with big beige head which dissipates fairly quickly. Rich dark fruit aroma, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is rich dark fruit (mostly fig), dark candy sugar, caramel, some alcohol, and some hop bitterness in the finish. Good beer, but not a favorite.
Shared 750 to chalice. Belgian character aroma. Very sweet dark fruits and sugar.
Dark no head. Aroma is classic belgian features (yeast, sugar, malt). Taste is sweet, rich dark fruits. Yeasty but not great depth. Thin. Overall, not a beer I loved, but very drinkable.
Dark reddish brown with light foam. Nice roasted caramel aroma. Malty caramel taste with some coffee and molasses. A little lighter than expected. Very good.

750 bottle, Reddish brown pour. Belgian yeast nose, with fruits and alcohol. Toffee flavors along with dart fruits and a yeast. Some vanilla in the background. Palate has a softness to it. Little burn in the finish.

Pours a deep mahogany brown with a thin slightly off white cap. The aroma is sweet, big on dark fruits, burnt sugars, caramel, raisin, touch of anise. The flavour is also sweet, and big on the dark fruits, raisin, plum, light bits of chocolate and anise, caramel, grape juice, alcohol. Mouthfeel is soft and rounded, warm alcohol. Well crafted, but not as mind blowing as Id expected from these guys.
So much going on with the nose. Taste is complex as well. Lots of dark fruit. Caramel and toffee notes. Warm spices. Good alcohol burn. Nice

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Kevin! Light, slimy brown color with mild copper clarity at the top. Creamy, beige head that makes plenty of noise as it fizzles down into a thick collar and skin. Sweet, sweet grapes, plums, and dates on the nose; plenty of dark fruits, softer and sweeter than most BSDAs. Other aromas include buttery toffee, toasted malts, earthy phenols, sweet esters, and a medicinal undertone that Im not digging. Taste includes figs, light clove, sweet plums, brown & Candi sugar, toasted malt, spicy yeast, and some burning phenols. It sounds nice, but these flavors dont "mesh" like they should for the style. They all try to fight too hard for the top spot. Not bad, but I feel a little let down, and the drinkability is a little hampered.

Bottle (750 ml). Courtesy of Sammy, thanks! Slightly hazy deep amber with a medium mostly diminishing beige head that leave a persistent ring of foam. Aroma is very fruity (dark fruits, raisins) along with Belgian yeast, spices, malt, caramel, light chocolate, liquorice and sweetness notes. Taste is moderately sweet with yeast, spices, malt, dark fruits, caramel liquorice, alcohol and light chocolate notes. Light alcohol warming. Medium to full body. Moderate carbonation. A tad boozy and sweet, but so complex and well balanced that it remains drinkable. Nice take on an Belgian Strong Ale by a top notch US brewery.

Bottle, shared by Chris - Thanks! Clear, chestnut brown pour. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, toffee and vanilla. Moderately sweet taste, very little bitterness. Full body, average carbonation. Overall: reminds me of pannepot. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Awesome range. Pours dark reddish brown. Raisins, prunes. Not much head or anything. Reminds me of the Unibroue stuff. Booze is well-hidden here. Soft carbonation. Some sweet malt, thick but smooth texture. Bottle from Premier Gourmet.

Tap at brewery. Pours a deep amber colour, somewhat brownish with a thin tan head. Aroma is heavy in brown sugar, dates, prunes and, toasted malts with strong caramel and toffee scents. Taste is rich and sweet but closes with a slight bitterness, quite balanced. Full body, soft carbonation, and creamy on the palate. Overall a delicious and excellent beer.
Bottle. Clear dark, small disc of carbonation and aroma of spicy caramel. Flavor is also spicy caramel, nuts & strong raisins.

Bottle. Pours dark amber copper with a thin tight khaki head that fades to a thin film. Aroma has malt yeast and raisin faded banana and clove. Taste has some spice with clove raisin and banana pepper. Palate is thin slick fizzy and dry.

Clear light ruby brown with medium creamy white head, lasting with lace. Aroma is fruity/belgian yeast, toasty, caramel, vanilla , sweet with a little alcohol- subtle and complex. Medium body, soft and rounded. Sweet, malty, fruity, just a little spice. Very nice balance. Pleasant alcohol warmth on the finish.

very yeasty aroma, a little toasty/roasty, caramel. 
taste- a wine complex to it, much sweeter and softer than the aroma. caramel, a little dark fruit. 
Complex, continue to taste something new with each sip.

Pours a light clear amber orange color with a off-white fizzy minimal head that doesnt last too long. Aroma is maltiy, caramel, sour, pruney and yeasty. Flavor is sweet, fruity with a little malt and some alcoholic notes. Finish is bittersweet. Mouthfeel is sweet while carbonation is belowaverage. Overall this is a delicious beer.
Bottle at BBS San Diego tasting. Aged for 3 years. Cloudy amber with a medium head. Aroma is caramel and wheat. Flavour is fizzy caramel, dark fruit on a lightly spiced bubbly finish

Brilliant orange with mahogany to brown hues. Nose is sweet and fruity with cherry, plum, bready yeast, toasted biscuit, caramel candy and faint roasted malt. Flavor starts with sweet cherry and dark fruits and fades to a lightly yeasty dark bread/toast and finishes with a nice toasted malt/moderate nutty roast finish. Somewhat dry, but enough lingering sweetness. Light syrupy feel. Like Horny Devil, solid but a little sweet. Some quad character, some dubbel character.

75 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark amber with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is vinous, caramel, malt, dark fruits, vanilla, and oak. Flavour is much like the aroma  with some warming alcohol.

Pours to a rich mahogany body with a medium thickness light tan head that has excellent lacing. The aroma is spicy, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, yeast. The flavor is rich, roasty, yeasty, spicy, chocolate. The palate is very warming, you definitely notice it.

Pour is a clear, dark reddish brown with a bubbly off white head. Lots of candy sugar and dark fruits up front on the nose, slight booziness, dark fruits like cherry and plum, and slightly piney. A nice cherry taste up front, some vanilla, sweet belgian yeast, there is suprisingly subtle chocolate flavor, some alcohol, and caramel.

750ml bottle from appellation wines. Pours light brown with a good white head. Aromas of Belgian yeasty goodness, sugar, vanilla and a hint of candied orange. Taste delivers more of the same, with a great balance between sweet and bitter. Seriously good beer, could be mistaken for a great Belgian beer. Which makes me question why we are paying people to move ingredients from Belgium to the US, brew beer, bottle it, then move those bottles back to the UK!
750 ml. bottle. Poured dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of dried fruit, brown sugar, malt, yeast. Semi-sweet flavors, fruity. The alcohol is masked well. Perfect balance. Awesome beer.

Pours toasty brown with thick off white head and nice lacing. Aromas of caramel, drief fruits, sweet malt breadiness, slight banana and clove. Taste is much of the same with a big dried fruit front. Prunes, rasin, caramel, subtle chocolate and spice. Finish is sweet and creamy.

750 ml bottle shared at tasting. Pours dark brown with a small fizzy head that fades quickly. Aromas are candy, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, and a light fruitiness. Taste is fairly sweet, caramel, chocolate, toffee. Some toasted malt too. Finishes with a Belgian yeast taste. Medium to thick body, slightly sticky mouthfeel. Very smooth. Very nice beer.

Pours a clear light brown/copper with a spotty frothy head. Aromas of big caramel, slight toffee, ester of banana, hint of wood, and a hint of cherry. Flavors of banana, oak, slight alcohol in the nose, big caramel, toffee, and light bread. Medium sweet. Alcohol noticed not in the flavors but the nose and throat only. Would be better with age.
Fresh baked apple pie. Flavor of ripe cherries and currants. Finishes like a fruit pie. Delicious. One to savor.
[US West Coast Trip 2013] Tap @ Alesmith Brewing Co. San Diego. Jäst, viss sötma, karmaliserad socker. Smaken likaså med en fint balanserad beska.
Critique cahoteuse de la St-Jean Baptiste: Un éventail dépice combiné au profil habituel dune quad, facile à boire pour sa grosseur.

2013 Bottle, big thanks to JF, split at the pre stag tasting in the Sham, 20/06/13.
Hazed dark amber with an off white head that dissipates to the edge.
Nose is toffee, dates, dark fruit, prunes, burnt sugars, light yeast esters, woody notes.
Taste comprises toffee, demerara sugar, toasted malt, dark fruit, oaky notes, dates, figs, light spice, caramel, touch of booze, Belgian yeasts.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sugars and light booze in the finish.
Decent stuff but no world beater.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle from Ryan, pours a reddish brown with a thin white head. Aroma of cherry, nuts, light spice and malt. Taste is some Belgian yeast, some light caramel and vanilla notes, nice light fruit.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

June 14, 2013 - bottle from Everetts.  Clear brown pour with nice head that faded quickly and spotty lacing.  Foamed up nicely with a gentle swirl.  Aroma was vanilla, caramel and spice.  Taste was consistent with aroma but also had some light chocolate notes.  Smooth and medium bodied.  First bottle to kickoff Alesmith night.

On tap @ Bambinos. Pours dark brownish amber with thin head. Aroma is sweet slightly spicy caramel malt. Taste is big syrupy sweet caramel malt and mild Belgian yeast notes.  Somewhat lacking nuance but this is a really solid beer. High abv is easily notable. Take on a full bottle of this at your own risk.
Dark amber colour. Caramel dark fruit aroma. Sweet, caramel, belgian yeast taste.

Rating #700. Brown hazy colour. big aroma with a fruit preserve quality mixed with cherry pie and a boozy whiskey and burnt sugar note. very complex aroma. Big beer with a never ending finish and fruity and juicy flavours that have a leather and fruit jam quality. Very fresh beer even if this one was a few years old. Amazing.
750ml bottle. Tons of slightly soured red fruit on the nose with burnt sugar. The same notes take over the palate. Fantastic stuff for sure.

On tap at RIBCO, pours a clear dark brown with an off white head and some lacing in the glass, the aroma is really sweet with a lot of malt and caramel with a little bit of dark fruit and candy sugar, the flavor has some dark fruit on the front end with a sweet caramel and chocolate like finish, for sure a sipper, I enjoyed this .

2003 Vintage. Poured a brown-ruddy color with a small wispy head. Aroma is smooth malts, some age on it noticeable. Aroma is smooth malts. Flavor is aged malts, not quite soy, but too much longer and it would have hit that level. Glad to have tried this one.
Aroma of alcohol, yeast, candis sugar and caramel. Bronce with tiny white head. Taste bitter and sweet. Thin and well carbonated.
Dark amber pour, almost nonexistent beige head. Aroma of candysugar and belgian yeast. Citrusy, malty and toasty taste, very type-standarized. Still very good, but not anything special.

0.75 l bottle. Offwhite thick head, deep amber. Caramel, grassy aroma. Peach, toffee, rasin. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours hazy brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, caramel, cinnamon and some apple.

A very good Grand Cru. Pours an amazing burgundy with a thick tan head. Not a huge amount of smell, a little bit of cherries and vanilla. Taste is very malty, with caramel and fruit. A little boozy. A lingering malty aftertaste. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Murky cider colored, with massive, fine-bubble, flotsam head, decent legs / Delicate nose of orchard fruit, caramel, oak / Light body, lively carbonation (let settle), crisp, some sweetness, woody, nice balance, alcohol well masked, with light bitterness on the finish / Stylish flavors of turning apple, date, banana, caramel, chocolate, coriander, straw, oak / Understated compared to some, but most fine.
Murky brown pour. Sweet, bready aroma with dried fruits. Medium bodied, and really smooth. Flavours replicate the nose. Great balance and depth. Alcohol warms on the finish. Great stuff.

750 ml bottle into chalice, no bottle dating.  Pours crystal clear reddish brown color with a 1 finger fairly dense cream colored head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers.  Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with some moderate streaming carbonation.  Aromas of raisin, prune, banana, grape, clove, caramel, dark candi sugar, toast, bubblegum, and earthy yeast esters.  Very nice aromas with good balance of fruity/spicy yeast esters with candi sugar maltiness.  Taste of raisin, prune, banana, grape, clove, caramel, dark candi sugar, bubblegum, toast, and yeast earthiness.  Lingering notes of dark and light fruits, clove, caramel, dark candi sugar, bubblegum, toast, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance and complexity of fruity/lightly spicy esters with malt sweetness; and almost zero cloying sweetness present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a slick, lightly syrupy, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is good.  Alcohol is well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a damn nice Belgian strong dark ale.  Very nice complexity of fruity/spicy yeast esters with candi sugar sweetness; and quite smooth to sip on.  A very enjoyable offering.

Smell of brown sugar, nuts, sweet bread, figs, typical Belgian Ale scents. Taste is too sticky. Lies flat in the glass. Vague whiskey/alcohol warmth in the finish. Not at all bad, but wildly overrated.

Bottle, 75cl from 2011 - Semi hazy red beer with a large disappearing cream head. Aroma is fruity with notes of spices, grapes, caramel and with hints of chocolate. Flavor is fruity with notes of red berries, grapes, caramel, bread, oak and tannins. Wow, Im wondering if Ive ever had this complex and well tasting beer. Very unique combination of caramel, chocolate and red berries.
Cloudy brown decent off white head.  Malty raisin nose.  Rich flavor, cocoa, fruit, tobacco earthy ... full flavor.  Carbonation is a bit distracting but has mellowed as its warmed.

Bottle picked up at Niagara Falls Consumers Beverages. Pours an almost ruby brown with a tan head that recedes to nothing, and spots of lace. Nose is sweet and boozy, dark fruits , grape, figs, spice. Tastes almost wine like, sweet malt, bitter, currant. Complex.

Large head biege colour strong carbonation deep salmon pour aromas alcohol port dried fruit yeasty goodness doughy dark fruit prune flavours are bright yeast doughy taste dark fruit prune port dried fruit excellent tasting yeast the finish lovely mix of fruiit and yeast linger on palate alcohol sweetness smooth throughout rewarding ale
murky brown with white head. The nose is fig, cake and spices. The pallet is light tartness with fig caramel and plum

9 mar 2013, tap at AleSmith. Light amber, clear, no bubbles. Nose is sweet, rock candy, Belgian strong yeast. Med/thin and moderately fizzy. Belgian strong ale all the way through. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours mahogany brown with a 1 finger, creamy beige head that has good retention and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is interesting for a BSA, lots of vanilla and chocolate, nutty note, buttery oak, toast and hints of dark fruit and booziness. Flavor starts off with lots of toast, some caramel, woody malt, vanilla, white and milk chocolate, alcohol, hints of  bananas foster, sauteed pears, floral hops, and mild dark fruit esters. Medium off dry slightly boozy body with a light carbonation. This is a very nice beer, it is really interesting in that it is a beer with high alcohol content and it is a Belgian Strong Ale, but while it is unmistakably both of those things it doesnt beat you senseless with either in any way. The alcohol, while noticeable, blends very well with other sensory aspects in the Aroma, Taste and Palate, and while the Belgian yeast leaves behind enough esters and phenolics to make its presence unmistakable, both chemical groups are mild enough to not overpower the surprisingly delicate balance of this masterfully brewed beer.

750ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga, MelnaZiema2013)
Fruity, juicy, light aroma, quite pleasant. Belgian body - a bit yeasty. And gluey. And boozy. Hot and burning from first the booze and then the bitter hops. That just dominates and anaesthatised your tongue, theres no chance for any beer tastes to get past that blockade. Basically a bit of a boozy mess, which is a trend Ive spotted amongst AleSmith, Im not sure what people see in them.
Dreaded first sip when I first smelled beer. Fruity...hate fruity.but beer was excellent.dry, roasty, caramel, raisin, vanilla,good crisp taste. Great brew, love u alesmith.

0.75l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. This is a lovely looking slightly apply-red looking clear one with a nice medium sized off-white islandy top. It smells of green apples, candied sweet sugar and it feels slightly fruity in general. Smells quite nice, but nothing especial. It has an average carbonation level and a nice oily mouthfeel. Some dark candied sugar in the taste, soft green grapes. Slightly sweet in the finish and all in all this is quite a tasty one. Enjoyed! 26.12.2012

75cl bottle at BrewDog,Birmingham shared with Steve.This bottle stated 10%.Poured a dark amber brown colour with almost no head at all.Aromas of fruit especially berries,roast malt and caramel all nicely balanced.Dark fruit and malty caramel taste with a little vanilla.Nicely rounded and balanced,tasty ale in the Belgian style,both of us enjoyed very much.

Cloudy brown with a decent white head. Aroma is raisins, dates, muscat, hint of booze. Slick mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a hint of boozy tartness on the finish. Taste is raisins, dates, brown sugar. Tasty but the booze really comes through.

Dark Copper pour clear with tan head. Vanilla, Dark fruit, heavy malts, a little boozy. Semisweet and full bodied throughout. 

Quite nice!
(Bottle 23/01-2013) Large beige head, clear amber color, smooth taste, well balanced, Belgium taste.
Bottle. Dark red color, not much of head. Juicy, yeast, fruits, malty notes in aroma. Malty, dead yeast, sweetish and quite recognizable taste of alcohol in flavor. Not really doing it for me.

Dark amber and a bit hazy. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Sweet yeasty aroma, faint caramel, faint fruit. Sugars. Flavor starts sweet, a bit astringent, perhaps the yeast, moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture. Soft carbonation.
caramel, toast, brown, clear, light brown foam,light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Bottle @ DØE / Hop-Head.dk tasting. Pours clear dark amber with a rocky white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, caramel, candy sugar, little sweet fruit, grapes. Flavor is sweet with malt, caramel, candy sugar, fruit, light spice and a little bitter, hints of booze. Full body, lively carbonation, sweet warmng alcoholic finish. Wel crafted and nice, but abit to sweet for me. 230113
Aroma is dark fruit and a hint of spices.  The flavor is dark fruit, mildly funky yeast, malts and a mix of acidity and tartness in the finish.
